channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WA

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet box brought to QA. DescribePack: 4-1 gallon plastic bottles were packed upside down in the box. 1 of the lids was loose and spilled some liquid in the box and on the other bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Lids were tightened.

item.title: Report E-2023080136
item.description:
Report E-2023080136

  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG West, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG West, LLC driver inadvertently opened a valve on the trailer prior to having the delivery hose connected to the storage tank. This allowed approximately 40 gallons of gasoline to be released. Graymar Environmental responded to the site and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report I-2023080008
item.description:
Report I-2023080008

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-30T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-30
  • City: SEATTLE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: DELTA AIR LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At DTW, on 6/30/23, a Cargo agent loaded a Dangerous Goods(DG) shipment(UN3082) into the back of a SEMI truck. A second agent was following behind, driving a forklift, with a different shipment. The second agent's forklift tines were sticking out on the other side of the freight and punctured a hole in the DG shipment. The agent pulled the forklift out of the truck tracking the DG into the warehouse. The DG was contained, and the Cargo agent(s) followed instructions detailed in the Emergency Response Guide book. The domestic area was evacuated (employees) for approximately seven hours. Clean Harbor(spill business partner) was contacted and arrived four hours later due to no available cleaning crews in the area. The Airport Authority and the Fire Department determined there was no immediate threat; however, they instructed the team to keep everyone out of the affected area until the spill was cleaned. The cleaning operation completed at 2320.

item.title: Report I-2023060049
item.description:
Report I-2023060049

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-31T00:31:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-25
  • City: ZILLAH
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: WILBUR-ELLIS COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: According to the information obtained, the following occurred. While at intersection, a leak was detected from tote, coming from back of truck bed. Free product released to the asphalt roadway and adjacent soil. GrayMar Environmental was dispatched to perform the cleanup. Washington Department of Ecology responded to assess and monitor response. Upon inspection, one 330-gallon tote was discovered cracked, which resulted in the release of approximately 130 gallons of product. GrayMar Environmental proceeded to transfer the remaining product into a recovery tote to prevent further release. GrayMar Environmental used absorbent material on the asphalt roadway and hand shoveled grossly contaminated soil into a stockpile, which was covered with poly, pending return for excavation. GrayMar Environmental returned the following day, excavated contaminated soil, and used a street sweeper to clear residual off the roadway. Disposal was coordinated in accordance with local, state, and federal regulations. There were no injuries or exposures.
